CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 16, 1953, pg. 3, reads: "Harmon Exhibit Comes to Pittsburgh - The Harlem collection of the portraits of thirty-four outstanding Negros will be on exhibition in lobby of the City County Building until May 29. One of the oil paintings in the show is that of Asa Philip Randolph, president of the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters, and the labor leader whose efforts at organizing a "March on Washington" was responsible for President Roosevelt's Executive Order 8802, which established the wartime FEPC. Standing beside Mr. Randolph's portrait are James O. Dougan, member of the city Fair Employment Pratices Commission; Mayor David L. Lawrence, Dean N. R. H. Moor, chirman of the Civic Unity Council, and Mrs. Louis Reizenstein, member of both the Civic Unity Council and the city FEPC. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left: James O. Dougan, Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, Florence Reizenstein, and Dean N. R. H. Moor, gathered around painted portrait of Asa Philip Randolph, in lobby of City County Building
